wikipedia_page.main: Godfrey Thomas Vigne (1 September 1801 – 12 July 1863) was an English amateur cricketer and traveller.

response: File:Trebizond Godfrey Thomas Vigne (1833).jpg|Trebizond from the south by Godfrey Vigne
The glacier is named after Godfrey Vigne (1801-1863), an early British traveller in Kashmir and Baltistan.  It provides access to Gondogoro (La) Pass.
It was also during the Sikh rule in 1831 that Kashmir experienced another great famine. Godfrey Vigne, who visited the valley in 1835 after the great famine, writes :
* Godfrey Vigne (1801–1863), English cricketer and traveler
Vigne's son was Godfrey Vigne who played first-class cricket from 1819 to 1845.
|Played in 60 first-class matches, mainly for sides connected to MCC. Father of Godfrey Vigne.
